metadata.title: CVE-2019-14827 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A vulnerability was found in Moodle where javaScript injection was possiblein some Mustache templates via recursive rendering from contexts. Mustachehelper tags that were included in template contexts were not being escapedbefore that context was injected into another Mustache helper, which couldresult in script injection in some templates. This affects versions 3.7 to3.7.1, 3.6 to 3.6.5, 3.5 to 3.5.7 and earlier unsupported versions.

criterions.comment: moodle: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
